'''Palpitoad''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''ガマガル''' ''Gamagaru'') is a dual-type {{2t|Water|Ground}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation V]].

It [[Evolution|evolves]] from {{p|Tympole}} starting at [[level]] 25 and evolves into {{p|Seismitoad}} starting at level 36.

==Biology==
Palpitoad is an amphibious, bipedal Pokémon with an ovoid body. It is mostly blue, with a tan oval marking lined with black stretching from the bottom of its belly to its forehead. Its black eyes are round. Its upper lip is round as well, and curves down sharply at the corners. Inside its mouth is a long, sticky tongue used to immobilize and capture prey. Its feet are small with three toes each, and its tail is oval and white. Three large, half-spheres encircle its head, each one light blue with a black base. There are four round, light blue bumps starting on either side of its lower body and stretching across its back. The bumps on its head can be vibrated to create either waves or earthquakes.

==In the anime==
[[File:Ash Palpitoad.png|250px|thumb|left|Palpitoad in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===Major appearances===
====[[Ash's Palpitoad]]====
A male Palpitoad appeared in ''[[BW032|Facing Fear with Eyes Wide Open!]]'', when he commanded a group of {{p|Tympole}} to attack {{Ash}}'s {{AP|Oshawott}}, who was trying to retrieve seaweed to heal his poisoned friends. After they failed scaring Oshawott away, he fights Oshawott alongside a {{TP|Cilan|Stunfisk}}, only for both to be captured by Ash and {{an|Cilan}} respectively.

====Other====
A male Palpitoad appeared in ''[[BW061|Battling the King of the Mines!]]'', under the ownership of [[Clay]]. He defeated Ash's {{AP|Oshawott}} in a [[Gym]] battle, but was defeated by Ash's {{AP|Snivy}} after she used {{m|Attract}} to infatuate him, and {{m|Leaf Storm}} to knock him out.

===Minor appearances===
Palpitoad debuted in ''[[BW031|Ash and Trip's Third Battle!]]''. [[Trip]] attempted to capture the Vibration Pokémon, but it managed to escape due to {{Ash}}'s clumsiness.

Multiple Palpitoad appeared in ''[[M15|Kyurem VS. The Sword of Justice]]'', during the {{OBP|Swords of Justice|M15}} legend.

A Palpitoad made a brief appearance in ''[[BW099|A Surface to Air Tag Battle Team!]]'', which made Cilan think Palpitoad could have been a good Pokémon for [[Soren and Rocko]].

==Trivia==
* Palpitoad shares its {{pkmn|category}} with {{p|Vibrava}} and {{p|Seismitoad}}. They are all known as the Vibration Pokémon.

===Origin===
Palpitoad appears to be a combination of a toad tadpole and a loudspeaker. Its spherical "speakers" were probably inspired by toads' "warts" and poison glands, or the {{wp|Surinam toad}}, an aquatic amphibian whose backs are covered in pockets that hold its eggs. Its Pokédex entry also mentions the fact that it creates vibrations underwater, also like the Surinam.

====Name origin====
Palpitoad is a combination of ''palpitation'' (pulsation) and ''toad''.

Gamagaru may be a corruption of 蝦蟇 ''gamagaeru'' ({{wp|Japanese common toad}}).
